data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Irma Bach | July 17, 2018 | Pearl River, NY
data.text:
Irma L. Bach, age 92, a resident of Pearl River and Walton, NY left this earth to be with her loving husband Henry on July 17, 2018.The daughter of the late Victor and Edna Manoly of Valley Cottage, NY, WeWa as she was known was born June 24, 1926 in Valley Cottage, NY. She lived a wonderful and giving life in Pearl River as Assistant Branch Manager, HSBC for 40 years prior to her retirement. Irma will always be remembered for her caring and giving of cookies and brownies she delivered to most every business and appointment she visited. She knitted countless Christmas stockings, blankets and stuffed Halloween pumpkins in addition to gardening and volunteering at the Delaware County Fair Grange and Catskill Mountain Antique Engine Club.Irma is predeceased by her husband, Henry and son, Ken. She leaves behind her brother, George (Unc) and wife, Shirley of Grant Pass, OR, sons, Tom and wife, Grace of Chester, NY and Jim and wife, Kathy of Pearl River and daughter-in-law, Amy Bach of Pearl River. She also leaves behind 8 grandchildren, Karen and husband, Tony of Wake Forest, NC, Tara and husband, Jon, of Highland Mills, NY, Jill and husband, Mike of Oakland, NJ, Terry and wife, Jane of Newport, RI, Robert and wife, Christina of Charleston, SC, Craig of Garrison, NY, Kyle and wife Kiley, of Pearl River and Zach and fiancé, Kayla Dorko of Croton, OH. She also leaves behind 8 GREAT grandchildren, Dylan and Carter Ventre, Kevin Jowers and Connor Mapes, Ryan and Chase Hurley and Mikayla and Andrew Bach.Visitation will be held at Wyman-Fisher Funeral Home Inc., from 3-5 and 7-9 PM, Monday, July 23, 2018. Service will be held Tuesday 10:30 AM at the funeral home and a Christian burial will follow at the Frederick Loescher Veterans Cemetery, New Hempstead, NY.In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made in Irma’s name to Villa Marie Claire Hospice, c/o Holy Name Medical Center Foundation, 718 Teaneck Rd, Teaneck, NJ 07666.

To send flowers to the family or plant a tree in memory of Irma L. Bach, please visit our floral store.
